context: Page: List of Grand Masters of the Knights Hospitaller | Section: Knights of Malta | Source: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Grand_Masters_of_the_Knights_Hospitaller
questions: Who was Grand Master of the Knights Hospitaller after Giovanni Paolo Lascaris and when?

table: Siege of Rhodes (1522), headquarters moved to Malta in 1530
Malta was attacked by an Ottoman fleet in 1551. The attack was repelled, but the Ottomans captured the island of Gozo, and later also the order's stronghold in Tripoli.
Continued the improvement of fortifications, expanding Fort Saint Michael into a major bastion and completing Fort Saint Elmo.
Valette became the Order's most illustrious leader, commanding the resistance against the Ottomans at the Great Siege of Malta in 1565.
Continued the construction of the new capital Valletta. Strengthened the order's fleet, and participated in the Battle of Lepanto of 7 October 1571.
Crisis in the wake of the Protestant Reformation. Expulsion of the Order of Saint John (Bailiwick of Brandenburg) in 1581.
Constructed the Wignacourt towers and the Wignacourt Aqueduct. Repelled the last serious Ottoman attempt at capturing Malta in 1614.
Died less than four months after his election, on 2 June 1660.
Commissioned the Italian Baroque artist Mattia Preti to start painting Saint John's Co-Cathedral in Valletta.
Siege of Candia + Mattia Preti's work at St John's Co-Cathedral completed.
Renovation of Auberge d'Italie in the Baroque style, improvement of Fort Saint Angelo and Fort Saint Elmo. Ottoman attacks were still expected, but there were no longer any notable engagements.
Instituted a widows pension for the widows of those fallen in the Ottoman wars.
Organised the Consulato del Mare (Consulate of the Sea). Established relations with imperial Russia.
Restored the city Mdina, constructed Fort Manoel and significantly improved the fortifications of Malta in general. Built Casa Leoni and Palazzo Parisio, and renovated Verdala Palace.
Improved the fortifications of Mdina, modernised legislation, renovated the Co-Cathedral of St. John. Naval engagements with Ottoman Algeria.
Expelled the Jesuits from Malta. In 1753 proclaimed the sovereignty of the Order on Malta and a dispute started with the Kingdom of Sicily under King Charles V.
Rising of the Priests (1775), bankruptcy of the order.
Instituted the Anglo-Bavarian langue and the Russian Grand Priory.
First German elected to the Office. Abdicated 6 July 1799 following the French invasion of Malta.
